channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: South Korea’s President, Yoon Suk Yeol, Released From Detention

item.title: What’s your VO2 max? The most important health metric you’re probably not aware of shows how fit you really are
item.description: VO2 max is one of the best indicators of your cardiovascular fitness—do you know yours?

item.title: What would Tesla be worth without Elon Musk?
item.description: Investors are starting to examine what they've long ignored: Tesla's bedrock value minus the "Musk premium."

item.title: Gene Hackman Lost His Wife and Caregiver, and Spent 7 Days Alone
item.description: The exact details may never be known, but Mr. Hackman, 95 with advanced Alzheimer’s, was alone for about a week after his wife and sole caregiver died...

item.title: Don’t call me a founder—I’m a female founder
item.description: More women entrepreneurs want to drop “female” from “female founder.” Here’s why they shouldn’t.

item.title: Jerome Powell says the ‘net effect’ of the Trump administration’s policies on trade, immigration, fiscal policy, and regulation will determine interest rates in the future
item.description: The Fed chair reassured an audience at the University of Chicago the economy was in a “good place” despite “elevated uncertainty.”

item.title: Gaza War Led to Deaths of More Than 3 Dozen Hostages, Officials Say

item.title: ‘You Can’t Pin Him Down’: Trump’s Contradictions Are His Ultimate Cover
item.description: President Trump’s shifting positions and outright lies have presented the American public with dueling narratives at every turn.

item.title: Alfred, No Longer a Cyclone, Makes Landfall in Australia
item.description: One man died in floodwaters, the authorities said, and over 330,000 customers were without power in South East Queensland.

item.title: Gwen McCrae, Singer Who Helped Open the Dance Floor to Disco, Dies at 81
item.description: Originally a gospel singer, she went on to meld soulful melodies with dance-floor-friendly grooves on songs like the 1975 Top 10 hit “Rockin’ Chair.”

item.title: In-N-Out’s billionaire heiress says she stood in line for 2 hours to land a job at her own store when she was just a teenager to shake the ‘stigma of being the owner’s kid’ and ‘earn respect’
item.description: "It really was that family pain and tragedy that really put each leader in its place."
